word_mean: 〔复nuclei〕细胞核：细胞内的圆形体，系光学显微镜下可见的结构，有一层薄的核膜，一个或几个核仁，不规则的染色质颗粒和核丝，以及弥漫的核质
神经核，核：一般指位于中枢神经内的一群神经细胞，与某一神经的纤维有直接的关系
核：于有机化学，指形成某种特殊化合物或一组化合物分子的基本构架的中心成分的原子组合

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent.: from Latin, literally kernel, inner part', diminutive of nux, nuc- 'nut'

encyclopedia.content: NucleusPLUS是为实时嵌入式应用而设计的一个抢先式多任务操作系统内核，其95％的代码是用ANSIC写成的，因此非常便于移植并能够支持大多数类型的处理器。从实现角度来看，NucleusPLUS是一组C函数库，应用程序代码与核心函数库连接在一起，生成一个目标代码，下载到目标板的RAM中或直接烧录到目标板的ROM中执行。

entry.def: The nucleus of an atom or cell is the central part of it.

example.ex: Neutrons and protons are bound together in the nucleus of an atom.
example.tran: 在原子核里，中子和质子是结合在一起的。

entry.def: The nucleus of a group of people or things is the small number of members which form the most important part of the group.

example.ex: The Civic Movement could be the nucleus of a centrist party of the future.
example.tran: 公民运动的成员可能会成为未来中间派政党的核心。

means.word_mean: 1. a part of the cell containing DNA and RNA and responsible for growth and reproduction
2. the positively charged dense center of an atom
3. a small group of indispensable persons or things;

sentences.sentence: "five periodicals make up the core of their publishing program"

means.word_mean: 4. (astronomy) the center of the head of a comet; consists of small solid particles of ice and frozen gas that vaporizes on approaching the sun to form the coma and tail
5. any histologically identifiable mass of neural cell bodies in the brain or spinal cord

sentences.en: The nucleus of an atom consists of neutrons, protons and other particles.
sentences.cn: 原子核由中子、质子和其他粒子构成。

sentences.en: These young people formed the nucleus of the club.
sentences.cn: 这些年轻人成了俱乐部的核心。
